ext_descriptions.ext_description: A interconnect_module_design_object_category lists the types of the categories of the interconnect module design.
specifies that category is interconnect module via;
specifies that category is interconnect module inter stratum feature;
specifies that category is interconnect module cutout;
specifies that category is interconnect module fill area;
specifies that category is interconnect module stratum feature;
A pca_product_design_object_category lists the categories of the PCA product design object.
specifies that an instance that in this category is an implementation of the assembly component;
specifies that an instance that in this category is an implementation of the assembly module;
specifies that an instance that in this category is an implementation of the assembly module component;
specifies that an instance that is in this category is an implementation of the assembly module component terminal;

specifies that an instance that is in this category is an implementation of the connected area component;

specifies that an instance that is in this category is an implementation of the cutout;

specifies that an instance that is in this category is an implementation of the thermal isolation laminate component;
specifies that an instance that is in this category is an implementation of the unrouted conductive interconnect element;
specifies that an instance that is in this category is an implementation of the unsupported passage;
specifies that an instance that is in this category is an implementation of the unsupported dependent land;

specifies that an instance that is in this category is an implementation of the via terminal.
A spacing_type lists the types of the spacing.
specifies that spacing is measured between nearest boundaries of the design items indicated;
specifies that spacing is measured between centroids of the design items indicated;
specifies that spacing is measured between furthest boundaries of the design items indicated.

An Interconnect_module_constraint_region is a type of . An Interconnect_module_constraint_region is a region within an in which a placement constraint on some category of design object is to be met by the design. An Interconnect_module_constraint_region may overlap other Interconnect_module_constraint_regions.

ext_description.p:
an attribute is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Interconnect_module_constraint_region is dependent on the existence of the
that specifies the Interconnect_module_constraint_region as its
shape element. There shall be zero or one
for an Interconnect_module_constraint_region. The usage of this relationship is to enable traceability to original Interconnect_module_constraint_region during design iterations.
ext_description.note: Since the Interconnect_module_constraint_region is dependent on a specific , it is not possible to use the mechanism of associating one Interconnect_module_constraint_region with several , each of which is for a different design version. In addition, the non_conformant_interconnect_module_design_object is for objects within the scope, which also precludes direct re-use of the same Interconnect_module_constraint_region. It is expected that only the first Interconnect_module_constraint_region populated would have an associated shape to eliminate the need for carrying redundant shape data.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:

for the Interconnect_module_constraint_region. There may be more than one
for an Interconnect_module_constraint_region. The names shall be interpreted as the identification of A pplication Object categories to be constrained.

as the extent of for the Interconnect_module_constraint_region. There shall be one or more
for an Interconnect_module_constraint_region. The
shall all be for the same scope.
specifies the string for the Interconnect_module_constraint_region. The design_specific_purpose identifies the purpose the enterprise defined for the Interconnect_module_constraint_region.

specifies the role of the
for the Interconnect_module_constraint_region.

specifies the
for the Interconnect_module_constraint_region. There shall be one or more
for each Interconnect_module_constraint_region. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

specifies if the meaning of the Interconnect_module_constraint_region is to describe that items shall be in the interior of the
or shall be on the exterior of the . The value of TRUE states that objects in the constrained_design_object_category are not to be within the . The value of FALSE states that objects in the constrained_design_object_category are to be only within the .

an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Interconnect_module_constraint_region is dependent on the existence of the

for an Interconnect_module_constraint_region.
If precedent_version_constraint_region exists, it will refer Interconnect_module_constraint_region as .

The

Each non conforming design object that is a
shall be in the scope of the Interconnect_module_constraint_region.

ext_description.p:
A Layer_qualified_layout_spacing_requirement_occurrence is a type of
that describes the physical spacing between one of an interconnect_module_cutout, an interconnect_module_fill_area, an interconnect_module_inter_stratum_feature, an interconnect_module_stratum_feature, or an interconnect_module_via, and another of these categories of design objects. This Application object qualifies the spacing requirement to apply within a given context as defined by a set of . The category names correspond to the category of equivalent application object names as described in . This requirement shall be interpreted as applying to the categories of those objects.
ext_description.note: A pair of categories is used for this requirement occurrence.
ext_description.example:
In domain terms, when a Via to Via spacing is to be greater than 5 mm, the encoding will be that the spacing between the
whose value is interconnect_module_via and the
whose value is interconnect_module_via shall be greater than 5 mm.

In domain terms, when the distance from a cutout to a trace must be greater than 5 mm, the encoding will be that the spacing between the
whose value is interconnect_module_cutout and the
whose value is interconnect_module_stratum_feature shall be greater than 5 mm.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
specifies an
for the Layer_qualified_layout_spacing_requirement_occurrence. The layer_context establishes a context within which the spacing requirement is to be met. There shall be one or more
for a Layer_qualified_layout_spacing_requirement_occurrence. The
may overlap. All
specified shall be in the same design.

A Layout_spacing_requirement_non_conforming_design_object is a mean to specify one or more design object that does not meet object to object spacing requirements for the printed circuit board layout. There is no priority or sequential encoding intended by ending the attribute names with "1" or "2".

specifies a role of the
for the Layout_spacing_requirement_non_conforming_design_object

ext_description.p:
specifies one role of the
for the Layout_spacing_requirement_non_conforming_design_object.

specifies one role of the
for the Layout_spacing_requirement_non_conforming_design_object.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
specifies the
for the Layout_spacing_requirement_non_conforming_design_object. There shall be one or more
for each Layout_spacing_requirement_non_conforming_design_object.

specifies a role of the
for the Layout_spacing_requirement_non_conforming_design_object. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

specifies a role of the
for the Layout_spacing_requirement_non_conforming_design_object. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies a logical value.
There shall exist violation_value or violation_shape, but not both.

A Layout_spacing_requirement_occurrence is a type of
that describes the physical spacing requirement between one of an assembly_module_assembly_component, an assembly_module_component_feature, an interconnect_module_cutout, an interconnect_module_fill_area, an interconnect_module_design_intent_modification, an interconnect_module_inter_stratum_feature, an interconnect_module_cutout_edge_segment, an interconnect_module_interconnect_module_edge, an interconnect_module_interconnect_module_edge_segment, an interconnect_module_plated_cutout, an interconnect_module_plated_cutout_edge_segment, an interconnect_module_plated_interconnect_module_edge, an interconnect_module_plated_interconnect_module_edge_segment, an interconnect_module_plated_passage, a category consisting of the union of an interconnect_module_plated_passage category and an interconnect_module_plated_unsupported_passage category, an interconnect_module_unsupported_passage, an interconnect_module_stratum_feature, or an interconnect_module_via, and another of these categories of design objects. The requirement shall be imposed between the boundaries of members of the the relevant categories or between centroids.
The category names correspond to the category of equivalent application object names.
Support for requirements between boundaries and centroids is not supported by this part of ISO 10303.
Assembly_module_assembly_component corresponds to category. Assembly_module_component_feature corresponds to category. Interconnect_module_cutout corresponds to category. Interconnect_module_inter_stratum_feature corresponds to category. Interconnect_module_stratum_feature corresponds to category. Interconnect_module_via corresponds to category.
Any subtype of an item in a category shall qualify as part of that category.
This part of ISO 10303 supports several spacing requirements in this Application Object.
A pair of categories is used for this requirement occurrence.
In domain terms, when a Via to Via spacing is to be greater than 5 mm, the encoding will be that the spacing between the design_object_category_1 whose value is interconnect_module_via and the design_object_category_2 whose value is interconnect_module_via shall be greater than 5 mm.
In domain terms, when the distance from a cutout to a trace must be greater than 5 mm, the encoding will be that the spacing between the design_object_category_1 whose value is interconnect_module_cutout and the design_object_category_2 whose value is interconnect_module_stratum_feature shall be greater than 5 mm.

specifies the
for the Layout_spacing_requirement_occurrence.

for the Layout_spacing_requirement_occurrence.

The valid_non_conformant_design_object_context function returns true if there are no Laminate_components in input1 or if the assembly context of the items in input1 includes input2.
